definition: compassion, duty, propriety and integrity (idiom); all the traditional virtues/mainly used sarcastically, to mean hypocritical
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)
Germany/German/abbr. for 德國|德国[De2 guo2]

sentences.english: Now there is no moral to the story here.
sentences.chinese: 在這裏，仁義道德都是虛的，能賺到錢纔是真的。

sentences.english: Virtue is no more than a luxury.
sentences.chinese: 仁義道德，也是一種奢侈。
